018package org.opengis.filter.capability;
019
020import java.util.Map;
021import java.util.List;
022import java.util.Collection;
023import org.opengis.util.ScopedName;
024import org.opengis.filter.TemporalOperatorName;
025import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
026
027import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.MANDATORY;
028import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
029
030
031/**
032 * Advertisement of which temporal operators and temporal operands the service supports.
033 * Temporal capabilities include the ability to filter temporal data of specified temporal types
034 * based on the temporal operators After, Before, Begins, BegunBy, TContains, During, TEquals,
035 * TOverlaps, Meets, Ends, OverlappedBy, MetBy, EndedBy and AnyInteracts.
036 *
037 * @author  Johann Sorel (Geomatys)
038 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
039 * @version 3.1
040 *
041 * @see FilterCapabilities#getTemporalCapabilities()
042 *
043 * @since 3.1
044 */
045@UML(identifier="TemporalCapabilities", specification=ISO_19143)
046public interface TemporalCapabilities {
047    /**
048     * Advertises which temporal operands are supported by the service.
049     * Temporal operands listed here are defined globally, indicating that
050     * all temporal operators know how to process the specified operands.
051     *
052     * @return temporal operands supported globally by the service.
053     */
054    @UML(identifier="temporalOperand", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
055    Collection<? extends ScopedName> getTemporalOperands();
056
057    /**
058     * Advertises which temporal operators are supported by the service.
059     * Keys are temporal operator names and values are temporal operands defined
060     * {@linkplain #getTemporalOperands() globally} or locally for each temporal operator,
061     * indicating that the specific operator knows how to process the specified operands.
062     *
063     * @return temporal operators supported by the service.
064     *
065     * @departure easeOfUse
066     *   GeoAPI replaces the {@code TemporalOperatorDescription} type by {@code Map.Entry}.
067     *   It reduces the number of interfaces and makes easy to query the operands for a specific operator.
068     */
069    @UML(identifier="temporalOperator", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
070    Map<TemporalOperatorName, List<? extends ScopedName>> getTemporalOperators();
071}
